website_summaries.verdict: The lightest and most powerful tiller on our shortlist.
pros: Three speed settings and an effective 3/4-hp motor

website_summaries.verdict: Electric tiller has an instant-start engine that runs quietly as it cultivates soil.
pros: 9-inch wide tiller works well in tight spaces
Tills at depths between 2 and 10 inches
cons: Reset fuse trips after repeated use

customer_reviews.title: Mantis the best!
customer_reviews.text: Our second electric Mantis, the first having been absconded by our daughter. We actually totally wore out the tines on the first one and had to buy replacements! The wearing out had nothing to do with the tines and everything to do with the caliche we tilled and the amount of time we spent tilling through it! A thin elderly person can run this easily and it tills a narrow enough line to fit in a flower bed. We recommend the electric because you never have to us oil or have the mess of gasoline around. It has 3 speeds and is VERY quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Case

customer_reviews.title: Love my Mantis
customer_reviews.text: Love my Mantis tiller. I am 64 years old and a retired farmer. Makes the garden tilling so easy. I garden a 30x 30 fit plot. I love the electric model as I can no longer pull start things plus the added bonus of no fuel or fumes.
customer_reviews.author: Suzina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! I wasn't expecting much from an electric tiller- it probably wouldn't be strong enough-I was prepared for disappointment. But it was fantastic- I assembled it in under 30 minutes and then tilled away all morning. Easy to clear when the blades jammed, relatively easy to use once I got the hang of steering it. Super easy clean up at the end of the day. Just perfect for tilling my periennial beds and garden.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Good power for a small size
customer_reviews.text: We got so tired of taking in our old tiller for maintenance when it wouldn't start nearly every year. I was so done with a gas motor. Having this lightweight electric tiller is fantastic. It doesn't have quite the power of our bigger gas one. It bounces a bit when it first gets started on compacted soil, but with just a little patience it gets just as deep and does an incredible job. And it's soooo light weight. much easier on the back and easier to get in place in small spaces. So glad we switched to this unit. Highly recommend if you're getting up in age like we are too.
customer_reviews.author: sandbreese

customer_reviews.title: ... a 2 cylinder Mantis for over 10 years and liked it but as it got older it was next ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a 2 cylinder Mantis for over 10 years and liked it but as it got older it was next to impossible to start. Very aggravating. Bought this electric just because of the auto start plus no oil or gas needed. Used it today and love it. Very powerful and I can even use it in my raised beds. Never had to go above the first level of power. Seems very well made. Thought it was supposed to come with a kick stand but it didn't. Not a big issue but would have been better. I recommend this mantis for all your small gardening needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It works great digging and tilling. It kicks out small rocks like mad and when tangled with roots and mud it's easy to remove the blades and untangle. The simplicity of use of an electric unit more than outweighs having to deal with an extension cord. No problem starting, no problem with flooding the engine, no problem with gas and oil, no leaks, no spills. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: An awesome little tiller!
customer_reviews.text: It's small enough to get in hard to reach places and powerful enough to till up hard packed dirt. Be sure to pair it with a heavy gauge extension cord to avoid damaging the electric motor. I bought a 100' 12 gauge extension cord to go with this. Although this has three speeds, the lowest setting was plenty for my landscaping. So glad I didn't buy a cheap, Chinese piece.
customer_reviews.author: J-DUB

customer_reviews.title: A must-have!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have had this years ago! It tears through even my clay soil and makes it light and workable.
customer_reviews.author: naekae

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived missing the coupler assembly that connects the motor to the transmission. So it doesn’t work new out of the box and clearly never was quality tested at the factory. At this price point, that is completely unacceptable. I needed to use this to get crops in the ground, and I can’t get replacement parts for 7-10 days.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Koeppel

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected for an electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: All Mantis gas tillers were sold out and on back order. Found a review and demo on Youtube for this electric tiller. Impressed with the demo and very impress when we used the product. My son and I use the tiller to help dig a 80ft trench for a stone retaining wall. Our soil is very compact and hard clay in some spots. Got through most if it on it's own. There were some spots we had to use a pick ax to break the clay. This made our job must easier digging a 80 foot trench that needed to be 9 inches deep and 10 inches wide. Very pleases wit this electric tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: This item broke with the first use. Amazon was very good about it and did a no questions asked return.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Strong easy handling tiller
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tiller for a small garden. I have had one of these before so I knew what I was duying. It's light weight and easy handling is perfect. I am 5 ft 1 and 64 yrs old female, a big tiller is just too much for me. I have a beautiful garden.
customer_reviews.author: tealpond

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch for such a little guy
customer_reviews.text: I have completely tore up the grass in my front yard (40' x 17') with this and it has handled it no problem. Every once in a while a stone gets caught in the blades, I had to stop and unwind the grass from around the axle and it needs to cool off from time to time, but otherwise surprisingly strong for the size. Very easy to handle (I am 60 yo and 5'5" woman). Next door neighbor had edging tools etc from one she used to have and gave them to me. Sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Olyve Oyl

customer_reviews.title: small, but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: Tears up the ground! Digs nice and deep with very little effort on my part. I'm about 115 pounds, and I can handle this unit without feeling like it is getting away from me. No gas, oil, or plugs to worry about. Fairly easy to assemble, and really easy to use. My garden is going to be so much nicer next year. I bought the kickstand too. Like it as well.
customer_reviews.author: gadget girl

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! We had a two cycle one a while ago that we beat the heck out of but it eventually wouldn’t start anymore. I was concerned that an electric version would not measure up but happily I was wrong. Great torque from the electric motor; the speed control is essential and works great too. The best part is not messing with gas and oil and my wife ( primarily uses it) can not worry about starting it. Mantis makes great products.
customer_reviews.author: VanB

customer_reviews.title: It worked wonderful and broke up the thick grass roots that had ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for me! I used it to break up dirt in a raised garden that had not been used in several years. It worked wonderful and broke up the thick grass roots that had taken over the area. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Christi Conner

customer_reviews.title: Delivered on time, fairly easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: In spite of confusing and contradictory delivery promises it arrived on time. Assembly was fairly easy with very detailed directions (imagine if this had been made "elsewhere". Assembled in a couple of hours and put right to work. Looks like it's just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Sox Wiz

customer_reviews.title: This small tiller over-delivers on performance.
customer_reviews.text: The Mantis 7250 electric tiller is a BEAST. Really, really, powerful. I am very pleasantly surprised how easily it makes short work of small and larger jobs. It is lightweight, easily portable using the convenient built in handle, and it folds to fit in the back of my compact vehicle so I can take it back and forth between my small home garden and our large family community garden. I have always wanted one of these, and should have bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Holland

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I had a Mantis Electric for almost 20 years. Worked it hard and tilled 100's of square feet, mostly in very hard rocky soil. The Mantis just kept tilling. I even did a trench 8 inches wide and 20 ft long. I just got the new one many improvements have been made, but it is very powerful. I love my Mantis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and strong
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with this thing. Ordered it after throwing my gas mini tiller off the top of a retaining wall in a fit of anger because it wouldn’t start. Super easy to use and plenty of power for tilling established beds. Probably be fine tilling sod if the soil is sandy. I’m hoping to go all electric for all my lawn tools.
customer_reviews.author: Tinner2u

customer_reviews.title: pain in the @$$ to put together but works reasonably well
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get some of the screws and nuts to tighten, handle nut loosened easily but did what it was supposed to for garden. High priced for effort needed to put it together
customer_reviews.author: Michele Monaco

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiller!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! It really beats using the gas powered tiller. Easy to control, light weight, so it's easy to carry around. Best of all, no rope to pull to start or gas to buy ans store.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Leading brand and built to last
customer_reviews.text: The product is a national leading brand. The price on Amazon was also competitive. Satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Wandering

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how much assembly was required. I was able to follow the directions and got it put together, however, I had to ask someone to tighten the bolts because I didn't have the strength in my wrists to do it myself. That being said, I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Ryburn

customer_reviews.title: Must pull toward yourself to make it work, not push or follow like other tillers.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike except cleaning the tines, but that’s every tiller. I like the size, light weight, ease of use in small spaces and being able to fold the handles down for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Anne L. Capezzuto

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Worked as well and the gas powered model. Will not be wondering if the thing will start next year. Tilled my garden and flower beds easily.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N Whittemore

customer_reviews.title: The only problem I have is trying to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have is trying to use it under a big maple tree with many roots to battle with. Had to go over the area several time with taking the teeth off to clear the roots. A powerful tool. Haven't tried the edger.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Cecilia

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. But it is a Tiller, and you still have tot do the work, Not being Gas makes it so simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice to see this item come as battery operated to ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult for me to control. It should come with stabilizing wheels as part of the package. It would be nice to see this item come as battery operated to eliminate the cord which always seems to be in the way.
customer_reviews.author: DianeGem

customer_reviews.title: Options need to be standard
customer_reviews.text: Without the optional wheels, this small tiller is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: WACAC

customer_reviews.title: Why Not Sooner?
customer_reviews.text: As an Iowa farm boy of many years ago, I'm impressed. Light weight. Have only used first 'gear' and it churns up our clay-based soil here on the west coast with ease. Absolutely satisfied. Why didn't I buy this years ago?? Would be nice if the stand came along for free.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Great product and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Does all that was advertised. Great product and good quality.. Tough built
customer_reviews.author: Hooder

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our gas Mantis with the electric. No noise or pollution with all the other great features. In love!
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: The best rototiller/cultivator I've had
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool. I've had other rototillers. But this is the best I've had so far. I just wish the kickstand came with it as a standard feature.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble,it did its job as advertised. Very pleased with the results. Worth every dime!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Prudden

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Much better than I had expected. This little tiller is well built and powerful. The tilling depth is amazing and exactly what I needed to prepare our garden for fall. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: The electric tiller is quieter and more controlled than the gas models
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is quiet I can use it at 5:00am without waking up anyone
customer_reviews.author: Frank Dalessio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: Does a very nice job of tilling. I've been using it to remove grass to make room for flower beds and I'm very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: The Inner Eye

customer_reviews.title: Hard to believe this is electric
customer_reviews.text: Strong and sturdy, excellent for my garden and plant beds
customer_reviews.author: Don Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great! Light weight enough for my wife to also use.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Expected better from a Honda product.
customer_reviews.text: There's two bolts that hold the motor onto the tiller. No matter what I try,they keep coming loose,thereby making the motor keep turning sideways. Also, the tines keep getting clogged up quickly with plant roots wrapping around them.
customer_reviews.author: RRD123

customer_reviews.title: Side Kick To My Gasoline Version.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for small projects close to the house, and my gasoline version for edging 275 feet of sidewalk on my corner lot. Bought after the local small engine shop screwed up my gasoline version during annual maintenance. The eventually got it repaired but gave me a heads up on the type of craftsmen that are out there now.
customer_reviews.author: pepenikos

customer_reviews.title: What a Gem!
customer_reviews.text: What a gem! We have a number of flower gardens and this makes quick work of weeding, as well as tilling. We decided not to compromise with a less expensive tiller and are so glad that we made this choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ela

customer_reviews.title: Two tries for happiness!
customer_reviews.text: I returned my original purchase because the reset switch was not working properly. (It turned the unit off every time after 10-15 seconds of use) The replacement has worked flawlessly and does a great job. I want to thank Amazon for their excellent replacement policy and their outstanding staff.
customer_reviews.author: Perfessor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it, uses it in her garden. Light weight as they claimed
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Buy a garden fork instead.
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Truly awful. Tines damaged, handles falling apart, bolts falling out and now something is wrong with the engine. Contacted customer service and was given a list of people who would "service" it. Nearest one quite a drive for me. I don't want to drive somewhere to get this worthless junk serviced, I want a full refund. Buy a garden fork instead. Anything would be better than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: K.S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performer! Arrived in record time and was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Key

product_meta.title: Mantis 7250-00-03 Electric Tiller, Pack of 1, Red & Black
product_meta.description: You'll garden faster and easier than you ever dreamed possible! Easy to start, quiet and with no fuel required, the Mantis electric tiller weighs only 21 pounds. It's one of the lightest small tillers you can buy. Featuring a premium 3-speed, 540 watt Motor, this lightweight powerhouse is tough enough to till through sod and compacted dirt, but is easy to carry, easy to start and easy to use. 3-Speed operation allows you to set the tiller for digging, weeding or cultivating! All with no emissions! This is the tool you've been waiting for! Create your Dream garden! The Mantis tiller takes on heavyweight projects like busting established sod and compacted dirt or digging a planting hole with ease. The unique, curvy tines (blades) can till a full 10 inches deep. Then with a simple flip of the tines, you can precision-weed around delicate plants and seedlings! This is a gardening tool you'll use all season long! Don’t hold back! Put this tiller through most any challenge.
feature_bullets: Weighs just 21 pounds, but as powerful as a gas model
The compact 9 inch width allows the tiller to get into tight spaces around your yard that larger tillers cannot get to
The unique, curvy tines can be used to till down 10 inches deep. Or, simply turn the tines around to shallow cultivate the top 2 to 3 inches of soil
Folds for easy transport and storage
Engine: Electric, 115V double-insulated ¾ hp, 540W circuit breaker No fuel required
